page.title: 15The Pump House
page.content: When the Hydro Electric Scheme started there were flood-banks put along parts of the river. There was also a pump house built on Carlingwark Lane. When there is a high flow of water coming down the river to make the electricity the pumps can be put on to control the flow of water from Carlingwark Loch to the River Dee. The fields round about the lane are mainly meadow-land. The lane was a man made waterway which was constructed for the purpose of taking marle which was then regarded as a fertiliser. The lane was designed to take barges filled with marle from Carlingwark Loch to the River Dee and then they went downstream to all the farms along the river.
